metadata.title: Oseltamivir-resistant influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 virus in southern Brazil

abstract.original_text: The neuraminidase (NA) genes of A(H1N1)pdm09 influenza virus isolates from 306 infected patients were analysed. The circulation of oseltamivir-resistant viruses in Brazil has not been reported previously. Clinical samples were collected in the state of Rio Grande do Sul (RS) from 2009-2011 and two NA inhibitor-resistant mutants were identified, one in 2009 (H275Y) and the other in 2011 (S247N). This study revealed a low prevalence of resistant viruses (0.8%) with no spread of the resistant mutants throughout RS.

sentences.segment_text: The neuraminidase ( NA ) genes of A ( H1N1 ) pdm09 influenza virus isolates from 306 infected patients were analysed .
The circulation of oseltamivir-resistant viruses in Brazil has not been reported previously .
Clinical samples were collected in the state of Rio Grande do Sul ( RS ) from 2009-2011 and two NA inhibitor-resistant mutants were identified ,
one in 2009 ( H275Y ) and the other in 2011 ( S247N ) .
This study revealed a low prevalence of resistant viruses ( 0.8 % ) with no spread of the resistant mutants throughout RS .
